name: Fashionably Late
description: Starfleet is intent on making their Convergence Day celebration the event of the galaxy. But not everyone is as enthusiastic. Stop a stolen Starfleet legend from bringing the jovial mood down!
rules:
-- In a Skirmish Event, you will engage in space battles against thematically appropriate foes until the Event's conclusion.
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- Unique Ship Battle Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using Birthday Cake Reed, any version of G. La Forge, Atoa, Worf, Festive crew, or crew with matching Battle Traits, will provide a bonus.
-- Using the U.S.S. Titan, the Generational NX-01 Enterprise, or the Galaxy Class Ship will provide a bonus to hull.
-- Every Ship Battle you win earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Birthday Cake Reed, G. La Forge, Atoa, Worf, or Festive

featured_crew.name: Kim
featured_crew.flavor: Kim is interested in the holographic Marayna, so he comes to the Luau party. But he leaves after learning that Tuvok is also not indifferent to the hologram.

action.name: Listen, I'm Going Back To My Quarters

featured_crew.name: Atoa
featured_crew.flavor: At Jadzia's bachelorette party, Lieutenant Manuele Atoa performs a fire dance that ignites the crowd’s excitement.

action.name: Thank For Getting Me The Day Off

rewards.name: Credits
rewards.flavor: Credits are the galaxy's standard currency. Use Credits in the Time Portal to enlist crew members, build items, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

ship.name: Galaxy Class Ship
ship.flavor: One of the largest and most powerful classes of ship in Starfleet's history.

rewards.flavor: Use to instantly revive a failed Voyage.

rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Kim
rewards.flavor: Kim is interested in the holographic Marayna, so he comes to the Luau party. But he leaves after learning that Tuvok is also not indifferent to the hologram.

action.name: Listen, I'm Going Back To My Quarters

content.reroll_info:
Skirmish rewards are additive. By continuously rolling you receive additional rewards. No rewards are lost by rolling again.
DROP RATES:
Event VP: 13.58%
Time Portal Pack: 0.13%
Chronitons: 11.45%
Honor: 14.11%
Intel: 27.43%
Credits: 33.29%

screens.text: "Captain, I apologize, I know I look rather...strange right now. My crewmates and I have been split up on various missions and yet Hoshi still insisted on throwing me a belated birthday party. But, uhm, I suppose that's not what's important right now."

"I know you're likely on the way to Starfleet's Convergence Day celebration, but I must advise against it. Stolen ships resembling prominent Starfleet vessels have been attacking those bound for the event and we can't seem to get through to the bridges of the ships."
"One of the few times being late has been to my advantage. But it's so strange. Many of the stolen ships seem to have had some adjustments made to them. It makes me wonder who could be behind this."
"We have been evaluating the possible culprits. But of course, we could gather a great deal more information if you managed to disable and return the stolen ships, Captain."

"Captain, I apologize, I know I look rather...strange right now. My crewmates and I have been split up on various missions and yet Hoshi still insisted on throwing me a belated birthday party. But, uhm, I suppose that's not what's important right now."

"I know you're likely on the way to Starfleet's Convergence Day celebration, but I must advise against it. Stolen ships resembling prominent Starfleet vessels have been attacking those bound for the event and we can't seem to get through to the bridges of the ships."
"One of the few times being late has been to my advantage. But it's so strange. Many of the stolen ships seem to have had some adjustments made to them. It makes me wonder who could be behind this."
"We have been evaluating the possible culprits. But of course, we could gather a great deal more information if you managed to disable and return the stolen ships, Captain."
"Nicely done, Captain! You managed to thin out their numbers to a manageable degree at least."

responses.text: "Add components? Why would they steal ships just to improve them?"
"Remove components? That sounds like thieves or pirates."

screens.text: "Still, we are no closer to verifying the identity of the thieves. The ships we have managed to recover were empty when we brought them in. All we know is that adjustments are being made to the ships to make it easier to add or remove components."

"I was wondering the same thing. But then it occurred to me. Perhaps what they want is the facade of a Starfleet ship in order to gain trust. After all, it worked here. But then they intend to surprise their victims with unexpected firepower."
"My thoughts precisely, Captain. Still, it is odd that they would steal a ship for its parts, only to return with it. Could they be after something of greater value?"
"The thought had crossed my mind, but I sure hope not. Do you have any idea what a nightmare it was detaching the Enterprise from the Franken-ship they chose to make last time?!"
"God, I can't sit here and listen to you idiots miss the forest for the trees anymore. I'm right here, Captain. Come get your ships back if you think you can."
"Nicely done, Captain! You managed to thin out their numbers to a manageable degree at least."

responses.text: "Add components? Why would they steal ships just to improve them?"
"Remove components? That sounds like thieves or pirates."

"My thoughts precisely, Captain. Still, it is odd that they would steal a ship for its parts, only to return with it. Could they be after something of greater value?"
"The thought had crossed my mind, but I sure hope not. Do you have any idea what a nightmare it was detaching the Enterprise from the Franken-ship they chose to make last time?!"
"God, I can't sit here and listen to you idiots miss the forest for the trees anymore. I'm right here, Captain. Come get your ships back if you think you can."
